DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Disease or Disorder Anatomic Site Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the metastatic and/or recurrent disease not previously listed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Disease or Disorder Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Occurring again._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:occurring again.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
